fabrication general provisions num through num .
section numseed and sod num c. acceptance num .
get approval from the engineer before sowing seed .
num .
ensure each bag of seed is tagged with an analysis tag showing the results of a test made within num months of planting .
a .
collect and check the tags to ensure that they show a lot number a test date within num months and that the seed quality meets the requirements in table num . b .
the georgia department of agriculture and the laboratory will randomly sample seed .
num .
even though the engineer approves the seed you are still responsible to furnish and sow seed that meets these specifications at the time of sowing .
num .
if the engineer requires provide seed samples to the engineer early enough before seeding to allow further testing before seeding .
num .
you may increase the rate of seeding to obtain the minimum pure live seed content specified if a low percentage of germination causes the quality of the seed to fall below the minimum .
note you may increase the seeding rates if the noxious weed seed per square yard meter does not exceed the allowable quantity at the regular rate of seeding .
num .
the department will reject wet moldy or otherwise damaged seed .
d. materials warranty general provisions num through num .
num sod a .
requirements num .
use living growing sod of the designated species for block or big roll sod .
this includes sod that is dormant during the cold or dry season and capable of renewing growth after the dormant period .
num .
obtain all sod from approved nurseries that have a georgia live plant license .
num .
ensure that at least num percent of the plants in the sod are of the designated variety of grass .
b .
fabrication num .
mow grass and weeds to a maximum height of num in num mm .
rake and remove the grass before cutting the sod .
num .
cut the sod into the following sizes block sodnum in num mm by num in num mm big roll sodnum in num mm by num ft num m ensure that the sod has at least num in num mm of soil adhering firmly to the roots .
num .
always exercise care to retain the soil on the roots of the sod during cutting transporting and planting .
do not dump the sod from vehicles .
c. acceptance the department will accept the material based on the following num .
notify the engineer to inspect the sod sources before it is harvested .
num .
the engineer will inspect the sod while it is being planted .
num .
the department will reject sod with weeds or other growth or foreign material that may be detrimental to the planting .
sod that is excessively dried out exposed to heat or not viable will also be rejected .
do not assume that an approval of a source means that the material is accepted .
d. materials warranty num .
transplant the sod within num hours from the time it is harvested .
section numseed and sod num num .
sod that is not transplanted within num hours shall be kept moist and protected from exposure to heat direct sunlight and freezing until it is transplanted .
do not exceed the numhour time limit for transplanting all of the harvested sod .
num .
cut and install sod only when the soil moisture conditions are favorable .
section numfertilizers num general description this section includes the requirements for fertilizers .
comply and meet the fertilizer requirements of the georgia fertilizer act of num and the georgia soil amendment act of num which regulates labeling sampling and tonnage reporting .
purchase all fertilizers through a georgia registered licensed distributor .
all fertilizer is subject to a sampling inspection by the georgia department of agriculture .
num related references a .
standard specifications general provisions num through num section num miscellaneous erosion control items section num grassing section num vine shrub and tree planting gsp num b. referenced documents georgia fertilizer act of num georgia soil amendment act of num num materials num fertilizer a .
requirements num .
use commercial fertilizer as a single nutrient or mixed grade .
num .
apply fertilizer based on recommendations from a public or private soil laboratory that participates in a national proficiency testing program .
proof of testing is the responsibility of the contractor .
provide a soil test report to the engineer prior to application .
take soil test samples in accordance with gsp num sampling testing and inspection specifications .
num .
from this recommendation use single nutrient or mixed grade fertilizers containing the nutrients nitrogenn phosphate pnumonum and potashknumo in amounts recommended by the soil test .
composted animal manure may be substituted for commercial fertilizer that meets the soil test recommendations .
see web based fertilizer calculators to assist in determining the correct analysis and amounts to be applied according to the soil test .
num .
clearly label the analysis on the fertilizer container .
num .
apply fertilizer as a dry or liquid material using equipment specifically designed for mixing and agitating the fertilizer .
dry or liquid fertilizer may be applied by use of a hydroseeder .
num .
any fertilizer that becomes caked or otherwise damaged making it unsuitable for use shall be replaced at the contractors expense .
section numfertilizers num b .
fabrication general provisions num through num .
c. acceptance the department will accept fertilizer that meets the above requirements .

num materials num plant topsoil a .
requirements num .
use plant topsoil with the following characteristics obtained from welldrained arable land but not from fields where tobacco grew in the last three years or where johnson grass or kudzu is present .
friable loamy soil with between num and num percent organic matter .
determine the percentage by measuring the loss on ignition of ovendried samples ignited at num f num c. reasonably free from subsoil heavy or stiff clay coarse sand and other deleterious substances .
has no toxic amounts of acid or alkaline elements .
can sustain healthy plant life .
meets the grade requirements of subsection num.a.num .
num .
the department reserves the right to inspect all plant topsoil during the planting period .
the department will reject any material that does not meet the specifications .
num .
do not use frozen muddy or nonfriable topsoil .
num .
before delivering any topsoil to the job site clear stones larger than num in num mm size and roots sticks brush coarse litter and other substances that would interfere with mixing planting and maintenance .

can be distributed uniformly when properly loosened produce the desired results meet the moisture requirements specified herein contain no excessive amounts of noxious weed seeds num .
noxious weed seeds do not use hay or straw mulch material that has matured seeds from noxious weeds or other species that would harm surrounding farmland .
num .
moisture content ensure that the mulch material is reasonably dry .
num .
erosion control compost use erosion control compost that consists of num untreated wood chips blended with num general use compost measured by volume .
a .
wood chips shall be fresh or partially composted wood chips less than or equal to num in num mm in length with num passing a num in num mm sieve and less than num passing a num in num mm sieve .
wood chips shall not contain any visible refuse or other physical contaminants material toxic to plant growth or over num sand silt clay or rock material .
b .
produce general use compost by aerobic biological decomposition of organic matter .
compost feedstock may include but is not limited to leaves and yard trimmings class a biosolids food scraps food processing residuals manure or other agricultural residuals forest residues bark and paper .
compost shall not contain any visible refuse or other physical contaminants material toxic to plant growth or over num sand silt clay or rock material .
mixed municipal solid waste compost and class b biosolids as defined in the united states environmental protection agency code of federal regulations usepa cfr title num part num are unacceptable .
ensure compost meets all applicable usepa cfr title num part num standards for class a biosolids and the following requirements table num physical requirements for compost test requirements test method organic matter content num dry mass tmecc numa particle size num passing num in num mm sieve num retained on num in num mm sieve tmecc numb soluble salts num max .
dsm tmecc numa fecal coliform pass tmecc numb ph num num ph tmecc numa stability num or below tmecc numb maturity greater than num tmecc numa heavy metals pass tmecc num and tmecc numb a soluble salt content up to num dsm for compost used in compost manufactured topsoil will be acceptable .
note all physical requirements are in accordance with the united states department of agriculture and the united states composting council test methods for the examination of composting and compost tmecc .

num vines shrubs trees and miscellaneous plants a .
requirements num .
use stock that meets the requirements of all state and federal laws for inspection of plant diseases and infestation .
num .
use nursery grown and collected plant materials that meet all regulations of the states of their origin and destination and that meet federal regulations governing interstate movement of nursery stock .
num .
use stock that is true to name and variety and is of first class quality with well developed tops and vigorous healthy root systems .
note use plant names according to the edition of standardized plant names in effect at the time of invitation for bids .
num .
use only nurserygrown stock that conforms to ansi znum american standard for nursery stock .
a .
the department will not accept plants andor trees that are severely cut back or pruned to conform to contract size requirements .
b .
the department will reject trees and shrubs that are undersized have poorly developed tops or root systems or are infected with disease or infested with insects .
num .
certification furnish all certificates of disease and infestation inspection a list of plant materials purchased and a complete list of nurseries from which each plant was grown .
b .
fabrication general provisions num through num .
c. acceptance the department will inspect plants at the nursery whenever necessary .
num .inspect and grade living plants for type size and quality according to ansi znum american standard for nursery stock .
num .
even if the department accepts materials after a test at the source the department may inspect the stock during planting and reject any that does not meet specification .
num .
the department will reject any of the following stock damaged during digging loading transporting planting and transplanting broken or loose balls or balls of less diameter than that specified large canopy shade trees without a single dominant central leader num .
replace rejected stock at your own expense .
num .
dispose of rejected stock to the satisfaction of the engineer .

b .

requirements num .

num .
use only purebred cultures less than one year old .
b .

c. acceptance the engineer will review acceptable cultures .

num .
peat moss use peat moss that meets the following requirements be granulated sphagnum virtually free from woody substances consisting of at least num percent partially decomposed stems and leaves of sphagnum be essentially brown in color be free of sticks stones and mineral matter be in an airdry condition shows an acid reaction of num ph to num ph meets state and federal regulations num .
pine bark use pine bark that meets the following requirements be obtained from diseasefree wood num percent of which is num in² num mm² or less in area and num percent is more than num in² num mm² in area .
contain no noxious weed seeds soil sawdust or any substance toxic to plant growth be at least two years old num .
compost use compost that meets the following requirements be organic materials that have undergone biological decomposition be disinfected using composting or similar technologies be stabilized so it is beneficial to plant growth be mature dark brown or black in color and have minimal odors contain no human pathogens fall within a ph range of num to num provide to the department a list of all the ingredients in the original compost mix in the order of their relative proportions on a weight basis .
num .
hardwood mulch use hardwood mulch that meets the following requirements derived from diseasefree deciduous trees section nummiscellaneous planting materials num particle size of less than num in num mm diameter and less than num in num mm in length .
hardwood mulch shall complete two composting cycles of num of num oc so that all viable weed seeds are destroyed and no further decomposition due to nitrification will occur free from toxic levels of acidity and alkalinity derived from sources other than cypress trees provide test results stating that the ingredients meet federal state and local requirements for priority pollutant limits and do not contain levels of any chemicals that are harmful to plants or humans .
b .

requirements use zinc or aluminum coated steel fabrics fittings accessories and posts for chain link fence conforming to the following requirements num .
fence fabric use woven wire with reasonably uniform num in num mm square mesh .
ensure that the mesh has parallel sides and horizontal and vertical diagonals of uniform dimensions .
use the wire size specified on the plans or in the proposal .
a. zinc coated use steel fabric that conforms to aashto m num .
ensure that the wire and hotdip coating conform to aashto m num type i class c. b .
aluminum coated use steel fabric conforming to aashto m num .
ensure the wire and coating conform to aashto mnum type ii .
num .
fittings and accessories a .
tension wire use wire that conforms to aashto m num .
use wire coated according to aashto m num section num for aluminum coated fabric .
use wire coated according to aashto m num section num for zinccoated fabric .
b. fittings use fittings conforming to aashto m num .
num ensure fittings or accessories not included in aashto m num conform to industry standards for heavy industrialtype fences .
num hotdip the materials in zinc with aashto m num grade num coating .
for aluminum coated fabric you may use materials made from aluminum alloy num diecast or sand alloy num zgnuma or tenzalloy .
num use bolts and nuts that conform to industry standards and are zinc coated with the hotdip process according to aashto m num m numm .
num .
posts rails and braces use posts rails and braces that conform to aashto m num and astm f num .
diameter wall thickness and weight must conform to astm f num figure num summary of requirements for industrial fence and the physical tolerance and material requirements must conform to aashto m num .

coat gate frames after completing all welding .
b .

b .
fabrication ensure that the chain link fence fabric is produced by recognized good commercial practices .
num .
apply the zinc or aluminum coating to the fabric in a continuous process .
do not apply in roll form .
num .
carefully inspect the coated fabric visually both before and after weaving to determine the coating quality .
c. acceptance the department will reject chain link fabric that has excessive roughness blisters sal ammoniac spots bruises flaking bare spots or other obvious defects to any considerable extent .

num section numsign fabrication num general description this section includes the requirements for fabricating and applying messages on sign blanks laminated panels and extruded panels .

the materials requirements are as listed below material section posts for groundmounted signs num aluminum sign blanks num extruded aluminum sign panels num reflective sheeting num silk screen lettering paint num mast arm assemblies num demountable characters with type vi reflective sheeting num direct applied nonreflective characters num num .

num .
after the final metal treatment protect the blanks and panels at all times from contact or exposure to greases oils dusts or other contaminants .
num .

num painted signs a .
requirements num .
use paint in fabricating these signs that meets the requirements in this specification and is of the type specified .
section numsign fabrication num num .
do not paint sign blanks or panels on which reflective sheeting shall be applied .
b .
fabrication num .
coat the sign blanks or panels on one face and all the edges with one coat of primer .
allow the primer to dry thoroughly .
num .
apply a coat of the specified enamel to the primed face and edges .
a .
ensure the film is num mils num mils num µm num µm thick when dry .
determine the thickness with a suitable gauge accurate to num mil num µm .
b .
apply the paint with either sprayers or rollers .
num .
ensure that the finished paint surface is smooth uniform and exhibits neat work quality .
num .
ensure that the paint does not run curdle or separate after application .
c. acceptance the department will reject any sign panels or blanks with paint that is not of the proper thickness or with paint that has run curdled or separated after application .
d. materials warranty general provisions num through num .
num reflective sheeting signs a .
requirements use materials that meets the requirements of these specifications and is of the type specified .
b .
fabrication num .
apply the reflective sheeting to the face of the sign blank or panel with either an approved vacuum applicator using a combination of vacuum and heat or an approved roller process using heat when necessary .
num .
apply the specified sheeting type and level of reflectivity according to the sheeting manufacturers recommendations .
num .
splice the sheeting on a sign according to the sheeting manufacturers recommendations .
num .
age the sheeting for num hours .
c. acceptance after applying the sheeting properly test the adhesion to ensure it produces a durable bond equal to or greater than the strength of the reflective sheeting .
num .
ensure that the adhesion is strong enough to resist stripping from the blank when tested with a stiff putty knife .
num .
ensure that no air pockets or bubbles exist between the sheeting and the sign blank .

install num delineator posts in num rows of num each so that num row will be bumper hits and num row will be wheel hits in num pass of the vehicle .
b .
set the delineator post with a height of num in num in num mm num mm from ground level with the reflective sheeting facing the test vehicle .
c. use a standard american sedan or pickup for the test vehicle .
ensure that the vehicle has no unusually sharp hood ornaments or other appurtenances .
d. impact num delineator posts num times with the test vehicle at num mph num kph e. hit the posts five times at an ambient temperature of num f num f num c num c and five times at an ambient temperature of num f num f num c num c. f. after concluding the impact test ensure that at least num of the num posts remain intact are securely anchored and return to their original vertical orientation within an angle of num degrees .
g. of the num posts that remain intact ensure that they also retain at least num percent of their reflective sheeting and show minimal signs of distress cracking loss of rigidity .

fabrication num .
complete all fabrication including shearing cutting and drilling or punching holes before treating the metal and applying the face material .
num .
cut the metal blanks to size and shape .
ensure that the blanks are free of buckles warp dents cockles burrs and defects resulting from fabrication .
num .
finish each face of the blank to be a plain surface and flat .
num .
metal treatment use conversion coating or anodizing to finish the metal before painting or applying the reflective sheeting .
a .
ensure the finished sign blank or panel has a uniform lightcolored appearance without splotches or stains .
b .
if the finishing procedure produces an iridescent color ensure that the shade is uniform .
c. thoroughly clean the metal before finishing .
num begin cleaning with an etchtype alkaline cleaner or with a vapor degreaser using a trichloroethylene or perchloroethylene solvent .
num use the cleaner according to the manufacturers specifications .
num after using an alkaline etching cleaner treat the metal with an acid solution or desmutting compound .
use the desmutting agent according to the manufacturers specifications .
d. finish finish the metal with a chromate conversion coating or by anodizing with a chromic acid anodizing solution .
use the conversion coating compound according to the manufacturers specifications .
e. handling carefully handle the metal with a device or with clean cotton gloves between all cleaning and finishing operations and before applying the finish material .
be sure that the metal never comes in contact with greases oils dust or other contaminants before you apply the finish material .
section numsign blanks and panels num c. acceptance the department will accept the sign blanks based on results of chemical and physical tests on the materials approval of methods and procedures for metal treatment and acceptable quality of work of the finished blank .

num section numreflectorizing materials num general description this section includes the requirements for reflective sheeting .
num definitions reflective sheeting types type i mediumintensity retroreflective sheeting engineering grade that is typically an enclosed lens glass bead retroreflective material .
type ii mediumhighintensity retroreflective sheeting super engineering grade that is typically enclosed lens glassbead retroreflective material .
type iii highintensity retroreflective sheeting that is typically an encapsulated glassbead retroreflective material or an unmetalized microprismatic retrotreflective element material .
type iv highintensity retroreflective sheeting that is typically an unmetallized microprismatic retroreflective element material .
type v superhighintensity retroreflective sheeting that is typically a metallized microprismatic retroreflective element material .
this material is typically used for delineators .
type vi elastomeric highintensity retroreflective sheeting without adhesive that is typically a vinyl microprismatic retroreflective material .
this material is typically used for orange temporary roll up signs .
type vii superhighintensity retroreflective sheeting that is typically an unmetallized microprismatic retroreflective element material .
type viii superhighintensity retroreflective sheeting that is typically an unmetallized microprismatic retroreflective element material .
type ix veryhighintensity retroreflective sheeting that is typically an unmetallized microprismatic retroreflective element material .
type x superhigh intensity retroreflective sheeting that is typically an unmetallized microprismatic retroreflective element material .
type xi veryhighintensity retroreflective sheeting that is typically an unmetalized cube corner microprismatic retrotreflective element material .
num related references a .
standard specifications general provisions num through num .
b. referenced documents astm d num qpl num num materials num type i ii iii iv v vi vii viii ix x and xi reflective sheeting a .
requirements num .
use reflective sheeting that meets the requirements of astm d num .
num .
use reflective sheeting as listed in qpl num .
num .
use reflective sheeting that has been evaluated by the national transportation product evaluation panel ntpep test facility or other approved test facility .
section numrelectorizing materials num num .
submit the following to the department a .
a certificate with each lot or shipment stating the following the material supplied will meet all the test requirements listed herein .
you have performed the specified tests to ensure compliance .
you will submit test results upon request .
b .
fabrication general provisions num through num .
c. acceptance num .
the engineer will reject reflective sheeting in the following situations a .
the material fails to meet any on of the designated requirements .
b .
the material meets the requirements but later fails during sign fabrication or in actual field use .
cracks wrinkles delamination color change or abnormal loss of reflectivity constitute failure .
c. natural causes deteriorate the material to the extent that num the sign is ineffective for its intended purpose as defined in subsection num.c.num.b above .
num the average nighttime reflective brightness is less than num of the values specified in table num or table num .
d. materials warranty transfer to the department a performance warranty for type i ii iii iv v vi vii viii ix x or xi reflective sheeting issued by the manufacturer .
ensure that the warranties cover the full replacement cost including material and labor .
include in these warranties a provision that the warranty is subject to a transfer to the department .
submit a warranty from the manufacturer that states that the reflective sheetingprocessed applied to sign blank materials and cleanedmeets the outdoor weathering photometric requirements of astm d num .
section numsign paint num general description this section includes the requirements for opaque silk screen lettering paint and transparent process colors intended for fabricating high quality durable reflective signs and emblems by screen processing spraying roll coating or hand brushing .
num related references a .
standard specifications general provisions num through num .
b. referenced documents astm g num type d astm d num section numsign paint num num materials num silk screen lettering paint a .
requirements num .
process colors use process colors and toner that are weather resistant and designed for use on reflective sheeting .
a .
you may tone or blend process colors to make the desired color but supply each color readymixed to a smooth uniform texture .
b .
if painting on reflective sheeting use only paint recommended by the sheeting manufacturer .
num .
submittals a .
submit a numpint numl sample of each color paint from each lot to be used .
b .
submit to the engineer a certificate from the fabricator stating that the paint used on the project signs is recommended by the sheeting manufacturer and is of the same lot as the test sample .
num .
color and transparency ensure that the transparent colors have the following characteristics when processed according to the manufacturers instructions through a numxx screen onto silverwhite reflective sheeting background a .
produce a true color under both diffuse and reflected light .
b .
match the color samples submitted by the engineer .
c. allow good reflective brilliance of the processed sheeting .
num .
process color and toner use process colors that flow out and dry to a tough smooth glossy surface free of defects pattern nonwet spots and have a sharp edge screen processed .
ensure that the process colors have the following characteristics when applied according to the manufacturers instructions have an appropriate viscosity for the purpose intended .
dry to a solid film in num hours at num f num c and num percent relative humidity .
withstand curing at temperatures up to num f num c for num hours without adverse effect or embrittlement .
be removable with a recommended solvent before it thoroughly dries without damaging the reflective sheeting .
num .
durability num use weatherresistant colors when processed through a numxx screen and finished according to the recommended procedures .
num after cleaning ensure that the material meets the following requirements no appreciable color change no loss by either diffuse or reflected light no significant change in transparency when exposed to accelerated weathering for num langleys facing south unprotected at num degrees in south florida or num hours atlas twin arc weathering astm g num type d as per astm d num .
num after accelerated exposure ensure that no process color can be removed when tested by scratching through the surface applying cellophane tape over the scratched area and removing the tape with one quick motion .
b .
fabrication num .
when using color silk screen paint other than black thoroughly stir the paste before use and frequently during use .
stir especially when using reverse silk screening .
num .
ensure that the finished silk screen has no streaks .
if the paint has streaks the engineer or inspector will reject it .
num .
apply the paste on the silk screen with a rubber squeegee that is as wide as the sign .
section numsign paint num c. acceptance the engineer will approve the lettering paint based on the results from the color transparency viscosity dry time and removability tests from submitted paint samples .
d. materials warranty storage and packaging ensure that the material in storage for up to one year does not skin settle change color thicken or liver so that normal mixing procedures do not return the material to the proper consistency and texture .

section numdelineators num general description this section includes the requirements for center mount reflector delineators .
num related references a .

b. referenced documents general provisions num through num .
num materials definitions for optical requirements use the following definitions in this specification num .
entrance angle the angle at reflector between direction of light incident on it and direction of reflector axis .
num .
observation angle the angle at reflector between observers line of sight and direction of light incident on reflector .
num .
specific intensity candlepowerfootcandle mcd returned at the chosen observation angle by a reflector for each footcandle lux of illumination at the reflector .
section numdelineators num num center mount reflector delineators a .
requirements num .
use a reflector delineator made of a hermetically sealed acrylic plastic prismatic reflex reflector with a single grommetted hole .
num .
submit num delineators of each color to be used on the project to the department for testing .
num .
acrylic plastic reflector use an acrylic plastic reflector .
submit to the department the manufacturer of the raw material and the identification number of the particular molding compound to be furnished .
a .
ensure that the reflector has the following characteristics a clear transparent plastic face with at least num in² num mm² of reflective area the lens a heatscalable plastic back fused to the lens under heat and pressure around the entire perimeter of the lens and the central mounting hole a unit permanently sealed against dust water and water vapor b .
use a crystal colorless amber or red reflector as specified on the plans .
c. ensure that the lens has the following characteristics a smooth surface without projection or indentations other than a central mounting hole and identification number a rear surface bearing a prismatic configuration that will affect total internal reflection of light the manufacturers trademark molded legibly into the lens face num .
specific intensity ensure that the specific intensity of each reflex reflector used in delineators or markers equals or exceeds the following minimum values regardless of reflector orientation .
observation angle entrance angle specific intensity candlepower per footcandle mcd per lux degrees degrees crystal amber red num num num num num num num num num num b .
fabrication general provisions num through num .
c. acceptance num .
the engineer will accept the material based on test results optical seal and heat resistance of samples taken by the department .
the department will return undamaged delineators to the contractor .
num .
optical test a .
place the reflex reflector to be tested about num ft num m from a single light source that has an effective diameter of num in num mm .
operate the light source at normal efficiency .
note if using a test distance other than num ft num m modify all other dimensions for this test in the same proportion as the test distance .
b .
measure the return light from the reflector with a photoelectric photometer that has a minimum sensitivity scale of num x num footcandlesmm num x num luxmm .
section numdelineators num note use a photometer with a receiver aperture num in num mm diameter shielded to eliminate stray light .
c. place the light source center num in num mm from the aperture center for a num degree observation angle .
d. during testing spin the reflectors to average the orientation effect .
e. the department will reject a tested reflector if it fails the specific intensity minimum .
if more than num reflectors fail out of num tested the department will reject the lot .
num .
seal test use this test to determine if a reflector is adequately sealed against dust and water .
a. submerge num samples in a water bath at room temperature .
b .
subject the submerged samples to a vacuum of num in num mm gauge for num minutes .
c. restore atmospheric pressure and leave the samples submerged for num minutes .
d. examine the samples for water intake .
e. the department will reject the lot if more than num percent of the reflectors fail .
num .
heat resistance test a .
place three reflectors in a horizontal position on a grid or perforated shelf inside a circulating oven that allows air to circulate freely .
b .
set the oven temperature at num f num f num c num c and let the specimens sit at this temperature for num hours .
c. after the num hours remove the samples from the oven and let them cool in air to room temperature .
d. rejection the department will reject the lot if any sample shows significant change in shape and general appearance when compared with unexposed control standards .
d. materials warranty general provisions num through num .

prevents the sheeting from shocking off the panel when struck at num f num c. b .

num steel lighting standards and towers a .
requirements num .

when so specified .
num .

however do not use astm a numa numm aashto m numm numm steel .
num .
steel pipe use steel pipe according to astm a numa numm grade b or approved equal .
no hydrostatic test is required .
b .
fabrication num .
roadway standards unless otherwise specified do the following a .
make the shaft or appropriate shape continuously taper with a base welded to the lower end .
b. construct the standard of steel at least num gauge num mm thick to the dimensions required for the specified mounting height .
form the standard from one piece with one electrically welded longitudinal joint and no intermediate horizontal joints .
c. after forming and welding coldroll the shaft longitudinally under sufficient pressure to flatten the weld and increase the physical characteristics of the metal in the shaft .
d. ensure that the shaft has a reinforced handhole with a cover except where a transformer base is specified .
provide a num in num mm approved grounding connector in the shaft or base .
equip the top of the shaft with a removable pole cap held securely in place .
section numlighting standards and towers num galvanize the shaft with the hotdipped method in astm a numa numm .
num .
lighting towers a .
make the shaft to meet the requirements of the roadway standard subsection num.b.num .
b. construct the standard to continuously taper num to num inft num to num mmm .
c. ensure that the standard has the necessary dimensions and metal quality to meet the requirements for the pecified mounting height .
d. you may form the shaft in sections with each section having no more than two longitudinal welded seams .
e. use intermediate horizontal welds only at section joints .
f. make telescoped joints overlap at least num pole diameters measured at the minimum diameter of the inner telescoping section .
g. have field welding done only by an approved certified welder who represents the manufacturer .
ensure the welding follows the requirements of section num. h. repair any damage to spelter coating according to section num. i. matchmark all sections of the shaft so that the tapered sections are assembled properly .
num .
post top or other standards for special installation a .
make the post top and other standards meet the requirements for roadway standards subsection num.b.num .
b .
make the top diameter of the shaft num in num mm or include a num in num mm tenon unless otherwise specified to insert the shaft or tenon into the luminaire .

however if the standard does not reach a compression strength of num psi num mpa in this numhour period the inspector will reject the standard .
c. finish ensure that the standard has a smooth uniform finish from a water carborundum mechanical process that removes the laitance and surface content revealing the aggregate .

section numlighting standards and towers num num high mast luminaire support and lowering assembly a .

b .

num .
support head frame use a head frame with three supports for the suspension cables and a pulley for the power cable .
a .
place the suspension supports num degrees apart .
place the power cable pulley midway between two suspension supports .
b .
attach two pulleys to the inside of each support one at each end .
construct the pulleys so that the suspension cables ride freely in the groove of the pulleys .
provide cable guides and retainers to keep the suspension cables and power cable inside the pulleys .
c. supply a hood for the support head frame to protect against weather for all working components at the pole top .
ensure that the hood adequately ventilates the pole .
num .
luminaire mounting ring a. equip the inner portion of the ring with approved rollercontact springloaded centering arms .
the arms center the luminaire ring while ascending or descending the pole protect the pole and luminaires and prevent jamming during the raising and lowering operations .
make the rollers for the centering arms of a waterresistant nonmarking composition material .
b .
design the mounting ring to symmetrically mount the number of luminaires indicated on the plans .
num provide a weatherproof junction box and terminal board terminating the power cable and connecting the luminaire wiring .
num provide a weatherproof power receptacle to test the luminaires when the ring is in the lowered position .
num .
nonlatching device design a .
if the design does not have a latching device at the top of the pole position the luminaire mounting ring tightly against the support head frame .
note use a positive visible indication that the required force has been applied .
b .
make sure the luminaire mounting ring and support head frame can hold the luminaire mounting ring in place and prevent rotation while in the raised position .
num .
latching device design a .
use a latching device at the top of the pole to latch all three suspension points and support the total weight of the ring including luminaires .
b .
place all moving parts of the latching device in the luminaire mounting ring .
note use a positive visible indication of the latching position .
num .
miscellaneous hardware section numlighting standards and towers num use noncorrosive miscellaneous fittings fasteners and hardware for the support head frame and luminaire mounting ring .
use an approved means for locking nuts .
num .
hoisting systems a .
ensure that each pole has three suspension cables and one hoisting cable .
b .
use cables that have num strands of num wires each made of stainless steel aircraft cable according to milw num type num composition b. c. use at least num in num mm diameter suspension cables and at least a num in num mm diameter hoisting cable .
d. anchor the ends of the poles suspension cables to the top of the suspension cable bracket assembly .
pass the other ends through the pulleys on the support head frame and attach to the luminaire mounting ring .
e. secure the hoisting cable at the bottom center of the suspension cable bracket assembly .
attach the other end to the drum of the motordriven winch .
prevent future twisting and eliminate any tension developed during initial installation of the hoisting cable system .
f. use a wormgear reducing winch with a reduction ratio that is selflocking in both raising and lowering operations .
completely enclose the wormgear in a lubricating reservoir .
g. make the winch operable with either an electric drill motor or a nema frame motor as described in lowering device power supply unit .
h. provide a hand crank for raising and lowering .
i .
include a cable guardretainer for the winch drum .
this will force the cable away from the ends of the drum for spooling and prevent the cable from coming off the drum .
j .
design the entire hoisting system so that power cable suspension cables and hoisting cable may be replaced from the ground .
num .
lowering device power supply unit a .
use a lowering device power supply unit that is either an electric drill motor or a nema frame motor .
num equip both motors with a factoryset torque limiter .
power each from a weatherproof outlet or receptacle located in the service area of the pole .
num you may use a stepdown transformer to supply the required motor voltage .
b .
make the transformer an integral part of the power supply unit when required .
c. attach and lock in place the drill or motor at the pole handhole .
provide a remote control system that works from at least num ft num m away .
num .
high mast power cable a .
use extraheavy duty power cable in a jacket that resists oil and sunlight .
include in the cable the number and size of copper insulated conductors required on the plans .
b. securely connect the power cable to the luminaire mounting ring and the suspension cable bracket assembly so it will not damage the cable and supports only its own weight .
num .
pole disconnect a. furnish each pole with a molded case circuit breaker in a nema enclosure of the size and type specified on the plans .
b .
make the breaker accessible through the pole handhole .
get the breaker from the manufacturer of the raising and lowering device .
c. acceptance general provisions num through num .
d. materials warranty submit guarantees on materials and equipment .

section numluminaires num general description this section includes the requirements for the following types of luminaires roadway rest area high mounting height offset underpass navigation lighting num related references a .

num luminaires a .
requirements num .
standard equipment for roadway rest area high mounting height and offset luminaires use luminaires for these locations that have the following equipment a. lamps check the plans for the lamp wattage type and size .
b. ballasts use ballasts that meet these requirements unless otherwise specified section numluminaires num are part of the luminaire housing or in a separate weatherproof housing attached to the luminaire housing .
are used for multiple circuits unless otherwise specified .
operate at voltages shown on the plans .
provide rated lamp watts to the lamp through a range in primary voltage of num percent .
have a power factor of at least num .
provide enough open circuit voltage to start lamps at a temperature as low asnum f num c. are enclosed in an epoxy encapsulated covering mounted on the external pole base or cabinet .
c. controls the local power company will provide and install control equipment including photoelectric control receptacle contactor and other equipment unless otherwise indicated on the plans .
d. level indicator when shown on the plans as a required item ensure that each luminaire has a builtin device indicating the direction and amount of tilt over a range of num to num degrees in any direction .
ensure that the indicator has the following characteristics has three calibrations accurate to within num degree a level b num degree tilt c num degree tilt is clearly visible without aid in daylight to a distance of num ft num m. does not alter or reduce the amount of light from the luminaire .
has a transparent container made of clear ultravioletinhibited acrylic .
the lower surface is curvilinear in any vertical crosssection to support a spherical indicator and dampening fluid .
uses a clear dampening fluid made of num percent glycerol and num percent ironfree water .
uses a highly visible orange or red color ball in the spherical indicator that is chemically inert to the dampening fluid .
num .

requirements ensure that the traffic signal equipment and materials meet the plans and specifications .
all equipment furnished shall be new and meet the requirements of the following underwriters laboratory incorporated ul electronic industries association eia national electric code nec american society of testing and materials astm american national standards institute ansi section numtraffic signal equipment num international municipal signal association imsa national electrical manufacturers association nema applicable standards specifications and regulations of the georgia department of transportation traffic signal electrical facility navigator support tsef num e. confederate avenue building num atlanta ga num b .
fabrication general provisions num through num .
c. acceptance general provisions num through num .
d. materials warranty provide to the district signal engineer or maintaining agency all manufacturers warranties and guarantees for all signal equipment items listed in this document as well as any signal equipment listed in the plans except for state supplied equipment .
ensure that warranties and guarantees are consistent with those provided as customary trade practices or as otherwise specified in the plans standard specifications supplemental specifications or special provisions .
ensure and state that manufacturers and suppliers warranties and guarantees are transferable to the agency or user that is responsible for traffic signal maintenance .
and said warranties and guarantees are continuous throughout their duration .
ensure equipment provided under this specification shall be warranted by the manufacturer to be free from defects in materials and workmanship for a minimum period of two years from date of receipt or one year from date of acceptance of installation .
the exception is the other materials stated in this specification which have longer warranty durations .
ensure the manufacturer will repair any faulty equipment during this period at no charge to the department for parts labor or shipping to and from the factory .

the following specifications augment the caltrans specifications and take precedence over conflicting caltrans specifications .

power supply modules either the numa numb numna or numnb module shall be provided as required in the configuration requirements in the preceding item .

documentation shall include all components including communications modules .
specific reference is made to section num documentation in the caltrans tees concerning required documentation to be provided .

if unit is shipped with applications firmware installed it must be tested with the application e.g .
traffic signal control .
if a random sample of greater than num percent of the units tested is rejected then the total shipment shall be rejected and vendor will be responsible for all costs to test and repair all units provided .

ensure the num numb field io module functions with a model num lc or numlnnum controller assembly and is compatible with current gdot applications software .

ac power to the num unit and fault monitor logic output via num serial port num and output frame byte num bit num to the nema tsnum cabinet monitor unit cmu .
ensure it contains any configuration jumpers to be compatible with current gdot applications software .
ensure the num numn field io module functions with a model num lnnum controller assembly and is compatible with current gdot applications software .

num .
num numb power supply module the num numb power supply module may be supplied as a separate item and is an independent self contained module .
ensure that it is vented and cooled by convection only .
provide module that slides into power supply compartment from the back of the chassis and is attached to the backplane mounting surface by its four tsd num devices .
ensure the module supplies at least num amperes of numvdc .
ensure the num numb power supply module is compatible with models numl numlb and numlc controller assemblies and is compatible with current gdot applications software .
ensure the connection harness ps num on existing units can be mated with the numb module supplied .
a num numa power supply module may be provided in place of a numb module as long as it is labeled as such and there is no additional cost to gdot .
ensure the module supplied is appropriately marked as a numb or numa module .
num .
num numnb power supply module the num numnb power supply module may be supplied as a separate item and is an independent self contained module .

provide module that slides into power supply compartment from the back of the chassis and is attached to the backplane mounting surface by its four tsd num devices .
ensure the module supplies at least num amperes of numvdc .

a num numa power supply module may be provided in place of a numb module as long as it is labeled as such and there is no additional cost to gdot .
ensure the module supplied is appropriately marked as a numna or numnb module .

ensure that the terminal blocks allow for two connections .

ensure that the exteriormounting bracket is shipped installed on the cabinet housing .
additionally provide an aluminum plate which covers the bottom cabinet opening .

submit details for programming of the unused red channels for approval .

do not use screw in type fluorescent lamp .
the fixture includes a cool white lamp covered and operated by a normal power factor ul listed ballast .

cabinet fan and light shall be fed from num amp equipment breaker .

section numtraffic signal equipment num when extended the storage compartment opens to provide storage space for cabinet documentation and other miscellaneous items .

provide a top for the storage compartment that has a nonslip plastic laminate attached which covers a minimum of num of the surface area of the top .

locate shelf so as not block access to other equipment or modules including battery backup system .

provide metal strip that is mounted vertically on the rear rail .
ensure that the power strip may be used by block power supplies such that the block power supply does not block other outlets .
attach power strip to a permanent location that is easily accessible to devices in the rear of the cabinet .
provide hard wire connection to the cabinet ac power controlled by a num amp breaker .
do not use plug in power strips .
num .
surge protection equip each cabinet with devices to protect the control equipment from surges and over voltages .
design the surge protector panels to allow for adequate space for a wire connection and surge protector replacement without the removal of terminal blocks or panels .
provide surge protectors for the input sections as detailed below and as shown in the input terminal and surge arrestor detail .
supply surge protectors that meet the following specifications .
a. ac service input include a surge protection unit for each cabinet on the ac service input that meets or exceeds the following requirements provide a hybrid type power line surge protection device on the cabinet service panel .
install the protector between the applied line voltage and earth ground .
use a surge protector capable of reducing the effect of lightning transient voltages applied to the ac line that conforms to the following peak surge current for an num x num s waveform numa for num occurrences clamp voltage numa numv max maximum continuous operating current numv num hz numa series inductance ac lineac neutral num micro henries response time voltage never exceeds numv during surge spike suppression for num v spike num v deviation from sine wave at all phases angles between num and num degrees .
provide a protector that is modular and uses a num pin beau connector with the following terminals main line ac line first stage terminal main neutral ac neutral input terminal equipment line in ac line second stage input terminal numa equipment line out ac line second stage output terminal numa equipment neutral out neutral terminal to protected equipment gnd earth connection supply a protector that is epoxy encapsulated in a flameretardant material .
configure the equipment line out to provide power to the type num and to the num v power supply .
b. ac interconnect cable inputs section numtraffic signal equipment num use a surge protection device to protect each ac interconnect line as it enters the cabinet with a surge protection device that meets or exceeds the following requirements numelectrode gas tube type of surge arrestor striking voltage of num v dc with a minimum holder over voltage of numv dc a three terminal device one of which is connected to ground the other two are connected across each input respectively the units must meet the following minimum requirements impulse breakdown less than numv in less than num s at num kv s impulse breakdown balance num microsecond or less difference at num kv s impulse energy application withstands numa ac for one num second applied ten num times at three num minute intervals on either section current rating numa num x num s impulse capacitance num pf line to ground c. inductive loop detector inputs provide surge arrestors in the cabinet as shown in table num table num or table num for the applicable cabinet .
protect each inductive loop detector channel input by an external surge protection device that meets or exceeds the following requirements a threeterminal device two num of which are connected across the signal inputs of the detector with the third connected to the chassis ground to protect against common mode damage .
instantly clamps differential mode surges induced voltage across the loop detector input terminals via a semiconductor array .
the array appears as a low capacitance to the detector .
clamps common mode surges induced voltage between the loop leads and ground via solid state clamping devices .
withstand numa surge current occurrences of a num x num s waveform .
have the following clamp characteristics maximum break over voltage num v maximum onstage clamping voltage numv response time num ns offstage leakage current num a capacitance less than num pf ensure that the unit also meets the following minimum requirements peak surge current num times differential mode num a num x num ms common mode num a num x num ms estimated occurrences num num a response time num ns input capacitance num pf typical temperature num f to num f numº c to numº c mounting no .
num x numinch no .
num x num mm bolt clamp voltage num a diff .
mode num v max .
clamp voltage num a comm .
mode num v max .
